section.p: If you are installing the Database service, add and populate the database section of the clouds.yml file as described below. All fields are required unless otherwise indicated.
In your environment, the clouds.yaml file should be located at ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml. If this file does not exist yet, create it.

p.note: This section begins indented four spaces; look at the complete file to see how all the sections fit together.
p.codeblock: database: trove_enable_ssl: False ephemeral_ca_cert: <SSL Certificate Location> external_network: ext-net provider_network: SVC ntp_server: <IP address of the first Management Controller> keypair: default enable_ha: False flavor: m1.medium database_flavor: m1.medium messaging_flavor: m1.medium database_volume_size: 10 logstash_rabbitmq_host: <IP address of the HPE Helion OpenStack logging service> logstash_rabbitmq_password: <admin password for the HPE Helion OpenStack logging service> hotpools_enabled: True hotpools_max_instances: 1 hotpools_image_name: percona hotpools_flavor_names: 'm1.medium' project_id: <Project id of the project where the service will be installed. > control_plane_database_volume_type: <the Cinder volume type, see instructions below> guest_instance_volume_type: <the Cinder volume type, see instructions below> disable_rollback: true

dlentry.dd: This variable defines whether SSL is used internally by Trove. HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 implements SSL using HAProxy, so in installations of version 2.0 or later, this value must be False.
If SSL has been enabled on the public endpoints, this value needs to be identical to the cacert value provided in the Platform Configuration section of your clouds.yaml file.
If SSL has not been enabled, follow these additional instructions to determine the value that should be provided here.
The ID (GUID) of the external network. In a typical installation, the name of this network is ext-net.
The ID (GUID) of the service provider network. In a typical installation, the name of this network is SVC.
IP address of NTP server. In typical installations, this is the IP address of the first Management Controller.

Specify the name of a keypair to use when creating the Database Service. This keypair will be used for debugging purposes when logging into instances of the Database Service. You can use the nova keypair-list command to retrieve a list of existing keypairs. This key must already exist in Nova prior to installation. For information on adding a keypair, see Creating a Key Pair.
Options are True or False. If True, the database will be created with high-availability configurations. Ensure you have enough quota to do so. The default value is False.

The default is m1.medium. This flavor size is used when creating instances of the Database Service. You can use the nova flavor-list command to retrieve a list of flavor options.The minimum size is m1.medium.

The default is m1.medium. This flavor size is used when creating instances of the Database Service's MySQL Database backend.The minimum size is m1.medium. Larger flavors can be used for large or complex installations.
The default is m1.medium. This flavor size is used to create instances of the Database Services Messaging backend.The minimum size is m1.medium.
The default value is "10"; this is measured in GB (gigabytes). This is the volume size that will be used to create storage for the Database Service's MySQL database backend.
The IP address of the HPE Helion OpenStack logging service. In typical installations, this is the IP address of the first Management Controller.

The admin password for the HPE Helion OpenStack logging service. This password is stored in the rabbitmq_password variable in the /etc/beaver/beaver.conf configuration file located on the controller nodes.

Options are True or False. The default value is True. If True, a pool of "hot" databases will be pre-provisioned for use when a new instance is requested. This functionality greatly reduces database creation time. If False, remove all other hotpools configuration variables.
Default is 1. This is the number of "hot" databases to keep in the pool.
The default value is percona . For HPE Helion OpenStack installations version 2.0 or greater, this value must not be changed.
The default value is m1.medium. This is the set of flavor sizes to keep in the pool.
Project id of the project where the service will be installed.

This value sets the Cinder volume type.
The default value is LVM; if you are using LVM, remove this parameter from the file entirely.
If you are using Ceph for Cinder volumes, set this value to ceph
If you are using VSA, enter the volume type you specified when you created the volume. If you do not remember, use the command cinder type-list to retrieve a list of all volume types.

This value sets the Cinder volume type.
The default value is LVM; if you are using LVM, remove this parameter from the file entirely.
If you are using Ceph for Cinder volumes, set this value to ceph
If you are using VSA, enter the volume type you specified when you created the volume. If you do not remember, use the command cinder type-list to retrieve a list of all volume types.
This parameter is required and must be set to TRUE. This setting will prevent a complete installation rollback being triggered in case of stack creation failure.
